EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory Interface at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of the factory’s input and processing units:
• Cable Factory Input Chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5) (awaiting source items, flagged “out of fuel”)
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) placed using direction RIGHT
• Burner Inserter at Position(x=1.5, y=17.5) supplied with coal
• Assembling Machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) set up for copper-cable production

### Belt Depot for Extraction System at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Provides the link between raw material extraction and factory processing:
• Depot Wooden Chest at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) (crafted and placed as belt depot)
• Transport Belt Segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot Burner Inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) positioned next to the chest
• Extraction System Burner Inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5) – serving as the source for multi‐segment belt connection

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Connecting Transport Belts to Incorrect Targets
 – When establishing a belt link, do not target a steam engine directly. Always add an inserter to feed items into the steam engine and use that as the connection endpoint.
• Placing Entities Out of Range
 – Move closer to the designated target position before attempting to place an entity; this avoids distance‐related placement failures.
• Inconsistent or Undefined Target Variables
 – Ensure that target entity variables (e.g. for chests) are defined and referenced consistently to prevent naming errors.
• Insufficient Inventory for Placement
 – Verify that the necessary item (such as a wooden chest) is available in inventory before attempting placement.
